adrFormatAddress: 1619 3rd Ave Suite 202 2nd Floor, New York, NY 10128-1559, USA

originalText.text: When I first met everyone at Behavioral Associates I was immediately given a warm welcome by not only people at the front desk, but by all of the staff I interacted with in the office. Starting the mental health care process can be very intimidating, and being welcomed by an informative and helpful staff makes all the difference between finding the necessary care and feeling invalidated. Accomplished therapists like Anya Shumilina and Natalie Wallace expanded my understanding of not only CBT, but DBT as well during group therapy sessions and individual talks. If you are considering visiting Behavioral Associates I highly recommend it for both new methods of tackling mental health care without medication and passionate workers to facilitate the process.

originalText.text: I was dealing with a bad nervous breakdown and felt like I was lost with no hope until I found Behavioral Associates. From day one Dr.Reiner and his staff made me feel welcomed and safe. The therapeutic sessions, tools and friendly environment helped me to overcome my depression and anxiety and I am in such a better place now. I still have monthly sessions and at each session I learn something new in dealing with day to day life events that produce stress and anxiety. I am so grateful and thankful.

text.text: I was dealing with a bad nervous breakdown and felt like I was lost with no hope until I found Behavioral Associates. From day one Dr.Reiner and his staff made me feel welcomed and safe. originalText.text:
I attended this clinic for a few months and had a great experience overall. I do agree that the focus is very much on neurofeedback treatment; I was not entirely sure that this was for me. The recommendation was for sessions 2-3 times a week, and at $350 and hour it would be an understatement to say that this is a challenge on a student budget. Let alone the time commitment. Be prepared for this.

Whilst my therapists were young, I don't think it is doing them justice to write them off as "inexperienced". Alex and Pamela are very professional, highly qualified, intelligent, and caring. Group DBT therapy with Dr Scott Lloyd is relaxing and illuminating.
The psychiatrist, Dr Speken, is outstanding.

Something that bothered me was the policy of charging a penalty fee for missing a group therapy session with less than 48hrs advance warning. Seemed too stern and sort of insensitive. Nonetheless when I expressed my dismay the charge was lifted and an explaination was given.

If you have the time and means and you are serious about self-improvement/ getting better I do recommend Dr. Reiner and his team.
I hope to return at a less turbulent time in my life to reap the full benefits of treatment here.

originalText.text: Behavioral associates provides a safe and comfortable environment for me. I thought the therapists were engaging and really took the time to take care of me mentally. I would definitely recommend this agency for those looking to seek services!

originalText.text: Behavioral Associates have changed my situation from hopeless to hopeful.  I am still a work in progress, but I am improving after every session.  The staff is very professional and caring.  I highly recommend Behavioral Associates (especially when you have already tried every conceivable option!)
